title: 9 takeaways from Chanel Miller’s memoir, ‘Know My Name’
text: Just because sexual assault is common doesn’t mean we shouldn’t pay attention to each survivor’s story. At so many moments throughout Miller’s book, we come back to the same essential message: Rape happens to individual people with full lives and loves and dreams. So often the media focuses on what a perpetrator stands to lose if convicted, and this was especially true in Miller’s case, with so much media attention on her assailant’s education, accomplishments and future career potential. We take the victim out of the picture because empathizing with a survivor’s trauma is too painful for us. But Miller shows us her own full life: her childhood, her family, her past and present loves, her talents and dreams for her future. In doing so, she makes us understand how much the assault and the legal process cost her. “Know My Name” humanizes Miller throughout an otherwise dehumanizing process of pursuing legal justice.
